business.headline: You quit smoking and drinking. So why is your health insurance still costly?Even after quitting, insurers continue to charge higher premiums, and former smokers or drinkers are still treated as high-risk for years.

boAt founders step down before IPO: Should investors be concerned?Having been the face of their brands for years, these founders suddenly moving to non-executive positions has raised questions about intent and timing.

Fujiyama Power IPO opens for subscription: Check key details, latest GMPFujiyama Power has set its price band at Rs 216 to Rs 228 per share, with a lot size of 65 shares. At the upper end of the band, the IPO size stands at Rs 828 crore, comprising a fresh issue of Rs 600 crore (2.63 crore shares) and an OFS of Rs 228 crore (1 crore shares).

Ashok Leyland shares jump after Q2 results. Should you buy, hold or sell?Ashok Leyland's Q2 numbers lifted the stock, with analysts divided between strong margin-led optimism and concerns over the MHCV cycle's volatility. With targets ranging widely, is the next leg of growth convincing enough?

Honasa Consumer shares jump up to 9% after strong Q2 earnings: Should you buy?Honasa Consumer's strong Q2 turnaround, rising margins and category momentum have lifted the stock sharply, but stretched valuations and divided analyst views now raise the question: is the rally sustainable?

PhysicsWallah IPO struggles to find takers: Should you subscribe?Despite strong brand recognition and support from anchor investors, the IPO has so far been subscribed only 14%, reflecting weak investor interest.

Sensex, Nifty open slightly lower despite global optimism, record-low inflationAt around 9:21 am, the Sensex slipped 143 points to 84,323, while the Nifty50 fell 60 points to 25,816. Broader markets were also under pressure, indicating some profit booking after recent gains.

Gold, silver rate today: How will US shutdown end impact precious metals?After weeks of uncertainty, both houses of the US Congress have passed a deal to reopen the government, ending the longest shutdown in US history.

US government shutdown to end: Will it result in a rally for Sensex, Nifty?Stock market today: Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,950.5 points at 8:00 am, suggesting that the Nifty50 will open above Wednesday's closing level of 25,875.80.

Applying for a personal loan? Don't fall for these 5 common scam tacticsThe race to get fast loans has made many borrowers easy targets for fraudsters. Scammers use fake apps, urgent messages and sweet deals to trap people. Spotting the red flags can save you from serious financial trouble.

Gold prices continue to rise. Why are they climbing?After months of ups and downs, gold is once again on the rise. With fresh global triggers and growing demand, the metal is gaining strength. Here's a closer look at the factors fuelling the latest surge.

Retail inflation eases to record low of 0.25% in October as food prices fallThe latest consumer price index (CPI) print was well below expectations and marks the lowest reading since the current CPI series began in 2015, which uses 2012 as the base year.

Is your income tax refund delayed? Here's how interest is calculated on itWaiting endlessly for your tax refund can test anyone's patience. The silver lining? The government compensates you with interest for delays — at a fixed rate, calculated monthly. But there are rules, limits and exceptions. Let's decode them.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as US optimism sparks IT rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 595.19 points to close at 84,466.51, while the NSE Nifty50 added 180.85 points to end at 25,875.80.

Gold without the glitter: Why investors are moving away from physical goldIn October 2025, India recorded the third-highest gold ETF inflows globally, behind only the United States and China, a clear sign that the country's love for gold is being redefined in the digital era.

Buying a house just because you can afford the EMI? Think againThe calculator may say you can afford it, but life may say otherwise. A home loan is not just a financial decision — it impacts savings, career choices, and long-term stability.

Explained: Why Adani Enterprises shares have gained over 6% todayAdani Enterprises share price: The rise came after the company announced plans for a Rs 24,930-crore rights issue, its biggest fundraising move since the cancelled follow-on public offering (FPO) in 2023.

IndusInd Bank shares jump 5% today. What's behind the rally?At around 1:20 pm, IndusInd Bank shares were up 4.38% at Rs 862.05 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), with trading volumes remaining strong through the afternoon session.

India's direct tax collection up 7%, but refunds down 17.7%. What does it mean?India's direct tax collection climbed 7% this year, but refunds dropped 17.7%. It leaves taxpayers asking what's really driving the change.

Sensex jumps 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising todayThe S&P BSE Sensex rose 663.63 points to 84,534.95, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 196.25 points to 25,891.20 as of 11:38 am. The rally comes after days of sluggish trade.

entertainment.headline: Director Sundar C exits Rajinikanth's Thalaivar 173, produced by Kamal Haasan Director Sundar C has announced his exit from the upcoming project 'Thalaivar 173', which features Rajinikanth and is produced by Kamal Haasan. The director cited unforeseen and unavoidable circumstances as the reason for his decision to withdraw from the highly anticipated collaboration.

Hyun Bin's Made in Korea renewed for Season 2 ahead of December premiere Disney+ has confirmed a second season for its Korean crime drama 'Made in Korea' ahead of the show's first season premiere in December. Production has already started on the follow-up, and the new season is expected to arrive in late 2026.

Now You See Me Now You Don't review: Magic fades too soon to sustain the illusionRelease Date:Thu Nov 13, 2025 Now You See Me: Now You Don't movie review: The Horsemen return with new magicians in a globe-trotting diamond heist. The film offers flashy magic and nostalgia but struggles with a complex plot and coherence, says our review.

Not a public event: Rajamouli issues strict guidelines for Globetrotter gala Ace director SS Rajamouli urged fans to strictly follow the police-issued security guidelines for the upcoming 'Globetrotter' event on November 15. The grand gala will take place at Ramoji Film City in Hyderabad.

Are You Sure season 2: BTS' Jimin and Jungkook return this December on OTT The second season of BTS members Jimin and Jungkook's travel reality show, 'Are You Sure?', will begin streaming on JioHotstar from December. The eight-episode series, marks the pair's first joint project since finishing military service.

Delhi Crime 3 review: Shefali-Huma's show is gripping, gutting but lacks thrillRelease Date:Thu Nov 13, 2025 Delhi Crime Season 3 series review: 'Delhi Crime 3', delves into human trafficking with a gripping narrative.  The show, led by Shefali Shah's powerful performance, highlights social apathy and gender biases.

Vijay's Thalapathy Kacheri gets 44 million views due to bots? YouTube responds Allegations surfaced on social media regarding inflated view counts for the lyric video of 'Thalapathy Kacheri' from 'Jana Nayagan'. YouTube clarified its verification process and responded to concerns about bot-driven views.

Delhi Crime Season 3: Real-life 2012 case that inspired Shefali Shah's show The third season of 'Delhi Crime' explores the complexities behind the investigation into the abuse and death of the two-year-old. The latest season sheds light on a case that continues to haunt collective memory.

When Kajol needed 5-and-half inch Kriti Heels to match her Diwale co-star's height Kajol shared her funny first impression of Kriti Sanon from the 'Dilwale' sets, joking about her co-star's height and how she needed "Kriti Heels" to match up. Kriti added to the fun, recalling a spooky hotel incident and her admiration for Hrithik Roshan.

Larissa Bonesi's 'number 1' wish for Aryan Khan's birthday is cherry on the cake 'The Ba****ds of Bollywood' director Aryan Khan marked his 28th birthday with warm wishes from friends and family alike. However, it was a special message from his rumoured girlfriend, Larissa Bonesi, that stole the show.

Farah Khan talks about why Shirish avoids industry events: People ignored him Farah Khan shared that her husband, filmmaker Shirish Kunder, often felt uncomfortable at events because people would ignore him and focus solely on her. The choreographer-director shared that this led to frequent fights early in their marriage until they decided he would skip gatherings that made him uneasy.

KATSEYE opens up on receiving thousands of death threats: It's heavy and jarring Members of KATSEYE share their experiences with online hostility, reflecting on the emotional toll and the pressures of public life during an interview.

Composer Anirudh, Kavya Maran dating? Vlogger captures duo strolling on NY streets Musician Anirudh Ravichander and Sun TV heiress Kavya Maran were recently seen walking together in New York, drawing attention from onlookers and sparking public curiosity about their relationship.

Nawazuddin says his father was upset watching him get beaten up in early roles Nawazuddin Siddiqui shared that his father once asked him to stop coming home because he was tired of seeing him get beaten up in films like 'Sarfarosh' and 'Munna Bhai MBBS'. The actor said his father finally appreciated his work after 'Gangs of Wasseypur' made him a household name.
Huma Qureshi's parents feared film offer was a scam Actor Huma Qureshi has revealed that her parents initially believed her first film offer was a 'prostitution racket'.

Dhanush's emotional Tamil song at Tere Ishk Mein Mumbai event moves audience Actor Dhanush delivered a live performance of an unreleased Tamil version of a song from 'Tere Ishk Mein' during the film's audio launch event in Mumbai. AR Rahman played the piano and together, the two created a special moment for the fans.

Kris Jenner's plastic surgeon Steven Levine was the star of her 70th birthday bash Kris Jenner's star-studded 70th birthday bash, hosted at Jeff Bezos and Lauren Sanchez's mansion, featured A-list guests from Beyoncé to Oprah Winfrey but it was her plastic surgeon, Dr. Steven Levine, who stole the spotlight online. Levine, credited for Jenner's viral new facelift, was seen celebrating alongside the Kardashian-Jenner clan.

The Girlfriend box office Day 6: Rashmika Mandanna's film eyes Rs 20-crore mark Rashmika Mandanna and Dheekshith Shetty's 'The Girlfriend' has crossed the Rs 10-crore mark within six days of its release, maintaining steady box office momentum. The romantic drama's upcoming weekend performance will be crucial in determining if it can reach the Rs 20-crore milestone.

Rashmika Mandanna: Hope everyone has a Vijay Deverakonda in life, he's a blessing At the success meet of 'The Girlfriend' in Hyderabad, Rashmika Mandanna expressed gratitude to Vijay Deverakonda, referring to him as "a blessing" and sharing her hopes that everyone has such a person in their lives.

general news.headline: Trouble for terror-tainted Al-Falah: Site taken down, accreditation notice, ED heat Live UpdatesDelhi blast: Ever since it has been thrust into the spotlight following the Red Fort blast, there has been no end to trouble for Haryana's Al-Falah University. Now, its funding as well as accreditation are under scanner.

Double honour for every shame: Jemimah recalls family turmoil after World Cup winJemimah Rodrigues reflected on a painful phase in her life when her family faced false allegations and hate soon after India's early T20 World Cup exit last year. A year later, she turned her pain into glory, playing a pivotal role in India's 2025 Women's World Cup triumph and calling it God's way of lifting her family from hardship to honour.

Building 17, room 13: Al-Falah University hostel where doctors plotted terrorDelhi blast: Investigations have revealed that room number 13 in building 17 inside the sprawling Al-Falah University campus served as the secret meeting point for the terror module.

Ready for 2-front war with India, Afghanistan: Pak minister's latest blusterLinking the Islamabad suicide bombing to Kabul, Pakistan's Defence Minister Khawaja Asif said the attack was a "message from the Afghan Taliban" -- one Islamabad was "fully prepared to respond to".

Three days after Red Fort blast, severed arm found 300 metres away on shop roofThe blast, which took place at 6.52 pm on Monday evening, was so strong that a severed arm was found almost 300 metres from the site of the explosion.

ED arrests Jaypee Infratech MD Manoj Gaur in Rs 12,000-crore money laundering caseManoj Gaur was taken into custody under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) after investigators alleged his involvement in the diversion and misuse of funds collected from homebuyers.

Koli acquitted: Who killed the Nithari victims?Between 2009 and 2017, the narrative of justice in the Nithari case was defined by the relentless verdicts of the trial courts. Across multiple cases filed by the CBI, the Ghaziabad trial court convicted Surinder Koli in 13 cases, and sentenced him to death. Moninder Singh Pandher, the house owner, was convicted and sentenced to death in two cases.
India ranks second for office romances in new surveyAccording to a new survey by dating platform Ashley Madison, India ranks second when it comes to people workplace affairs.

From Jamia to jail: Chancellor of terror-tainted Al-Falah has a shady pastAccording to a former colleague who spoke to India Today Fact Check on the condition of anonymity, Jawad became a Mechanical Engineering lecturer at Jamia Millia Islamia in 1993. But his ambitions far exceeded the humble podium of a college.

CIA dropped modified poppy seeds to weaken Afghan heroin trade: ReportThe Washington Post revealed the CIA secretly dropped modified poppy seeds over Afghanistan for a decade to weaken its opium trade, a covert operation that proved costly and largely ineffective.
Field Marshal Munir's Musharraf planIs Pakistan's new dictator Asim Munir embracing a former dictator Pervez Musharraf's strategy of death by a thousand cuts?

Cops find man sleeping in car's trunk during routine check in Delhi, video is viralA man was found sleeping inside a car trunk during a routine police vehicle check near Delhi's Signature Bridge. The police confirmed no illegal items were found and issued a safety warning before letting them go.

Sania Mirza details emotional toll of Shoaib Malik divorce, recalls panic attackSania Mirza has revealed she suffered panic attacks after her divorce from Shoaib Malik. The tennis star credited her close friend, Bollywood director Farah Khan, for helping her through one of her lowest emotional moments.

CCTV captures Dr Umar at toll booth, masked, big bag seen in car's backseatThe video clearly shows a masked Dr Umar un Nabi, considered to be the most radicalised member of the Faridabad terror module, stopping at the Badarpur toll plaza gate, handing money to the collector, and glancing multiple times at the CCTV camera.

Why Bangladesh has been rocked by violence, bomb attacks againDhaka violence: Bangladesh's capital, Dhaka, turned into a fortress on Thursday as the International Crimes Tribunal delivered a crucial verdict against deposed Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.

UP doctor shares video of woman mocking daughter-in-law in labour, sparks outrageThe video shows the young woman lying on the hospital bed, surrounded by her family members. Her husband is seen holding her hand while other relatives laugh at the elderly woman's remarks.

Live: Haryana Police visits Al-Falah University headquarters; ED to probe doctorsDelhi Red Fort Blast Live Updates: A powerful explosion ripped through a Hyundai i20 near Delhi's Red Fort Metro Station at around 6.50 pm on Monday, killing 13 people and injuring 20 others. The explosion took place in a slow-moving car that had stopped at a red light just outside the Red Fort metro station. The Union Cabinet on Wednesday officially classified the blast as a "terrorist act" carried out by "anti-national elements." Stay tuned to indiatoday.in for all the latest updates.

Brezza used for recce of Red Fort found inside Al-Falah University: SourcesAuthorities on Thursday found a Maruti Brezza linked to Delhi bomber after a massive hunt was launched for the vehicle. The car was found parked inside Al-Falah University.

Video: Japanese woman marries AI partner she built on ChatGPT, names him 'Klaus'Her journey with Klaus began after the end of a long-term relationship that left her heartbroken. Soon after, she began conversing with ChatGPT for advice and emotional support.

Auroras shine, satellites struggle: Solar storm hits at 3.24 million kmphAccording to space weather monitors, storm levels have fluctuated between category G1 (Minor) and G3 (Strong), with blasts of solar wind now exceeding 900 km/s.

Literate, yet jobless: Are India's most educated states falling behind?Kerala, Goa and Mizoram have crossed 90 percent literacy but youth unemployment remains high. This highlights the urgent need to link education with employability and skill development.

If guilty, he shouldn't be spared: Brother of doctor arrested in ricin terror plotDr Ahmed Mohiyuddin Saiyed's brother told India Today TV the family believes he was framed in the Gujarat ricin plot, but said he must face full punishment if proven guilty after investigation.

Before drone chase, CCTV captures sudden knife attack on groom at weddingA groom was stabbed during his wedding ceremony in Amravati, Maharashtra. The footage shows the bride and groom standing on stage when the accused, identified as Ragho Jitendra Bakshi, calmly approaches and suddenly lunges at the groom, stabbing him multiple times with a metal knife.

Rashmika Mandanna fights back tears as she gets emotional at The Girlfriend eventA video of Rashmika Mandanna growing emotional during 'The Girlfriend' success event has gone viral, prompting reactions from fans and spotlighting the film's box-office achievement. 'The Girlfriend' is receiving rave reviews from critics and audiences alike.

A year later, she turned her pain into glory, playing a pivotal role in India's 2025 Women's World Cup triumph and calling it God's way of lifting her family from hardship to honour.

IPL 2026: Shane Watson joins Kolkata Knight Riders as assistant coach Kolkata Knight Riders have appointed Australian legend Shane Watson as their new assistant coach ahead of IPL 2026. Watson brings vast T20 experience and joins Abhishek Nayar's coaching setup as KKR aims to return to title-winning form.

Shubman Gill on workload challenge: Still figuring out how to manage three formats India captain Shubman Gill said he is still learning how to manage the demands of being an all-format cricketer, especially with leadership responsibilities across multiple teams.

Tough test against WTC champions, crucial series in WTC final race: Shubman Gill India captain Shubman Gill acknowledged that defending WTC champions South Africa would pose a major challenge in the upcoming two-match Test series. "We know that it won't be easy against reigning WTC champions. There will be tough moments. But we have handled them well. These two Tests are important in the race to the WTC final," Shubman Gill noted.

Ajith Kumar's new helmet design unites his faith, life story and racing spirit A racer at heart and a star by destiny, Ajith Kumar has transformed his helmet into a vivid canvas of faith, philosophy and identity. As the founder of Ajith Kumar Racing gears up for the upcoming season, here are the exclusive details behind his striking new helmet design.

PM Modi asked us to visit schools, inspire students: World champion Harmanpreet Indian women's team captain Harmanpreet Kaur was felicitated in Chennai on Thursday for leading India to its maiden ICC Women's Cricket World Cup title earlier this month. During the event, Kaur revealed that Prime Minister Narendra Modi had sent a message congratulating the team and encouraging them to continue inspiring the nation.

Shubman Gill breaks silence on Shami's Test snub: Selectors would give a better answer IND vs SA, 1st Test: Shubman Gill backed Mohammed Shami's quality but said the selectors are best placed to decide on his Test comeback, given the competition from bowlers like Prasidh Krishna and Akash Deep.

IND vs SA: In-form Dhruv Jurel slots in at 6, top-order intact: Cheteshwar Pujara IND vs SA: Cheteshwar Pujara believes Dhruv Jurel will take the No. 6 spot for India in the first Test against South Africa, praising his recent form and calling him a strong addition to the lineup. He expects the top order to stay unchanged and predicts a three-spinner attack.

Sai Sudharsan has potential but needs to start converting his starts vs SA: Pujara Former India batter Cheteshwar Pujara feels the upcoming Test series against South Africa will be key for Sai Sudharsan, who has impressed with his potential but is still searching for big scores despite several promising starts.

Pakistan move tri-series to Rawalpindi after Sri Lanka players flag safety concerns Pakistan has shifted its upcoming T20 tri-series to Rawalpindi due to rising security concerns in the wake of a suicide attack in Islamabad.

Euro 2028 to kick off in Cardiff, Wembley to host finalCardiff will host the opening match of the 2028 European Championship on June 9, while the final has been scheduled for London's Wembley Stadium on July 9, tournament organiser UEFA announced on Wednesday.

NZ vs WI: New Zealand cruise past West Indies after Duffy sparks top-order collapseJacob Duffy's four-wicket burst and a commanding opening stand from Tim Robinson and Devon Conway powered New Zealand to an eight-wicket win over the West Indies. The visitors crumbled early and never recovered as the hosts wrapped up the chase with ease.

No past scars, no fear: Hashim Amla on why South Africa's rookies may thrive in IndiaHashim Amla believes South Africa's inexperience in Indian conditions could be a hidden strength, freeing the Proteas from past baggage. With only five players from the 2019 tour returning, he feels a fresh mindset may help them rewrite their story in India.

Australia's Steve Smith questions England's all-out pace plans for AshesSteve Smith believes England may have picked the wrong bowlers for the Ashes, arguing that Australian wickets are likely to reward seam and swing more than an all-out pace attack.

ISL, I-League clubs to meet Sports Minister after failed talks with AIFF chiefThe crisis in Indian football escalated on Wednesday, landing at the doorstep of Sports Minister Mansukh Mandaviya after talks between the national federation and CEOs of Indian Super League (ISL) clubs failed to resolve the deadlock that has stalled the domestic circuit.

Tyre smoke, control: India's drift king Sanam Sekhon on his Guinness record rideIndia's very own Drift King, Sanam Sekhon, did the unthinkable when he pulled off the perfect drift to claim the Guinness World Record at the Umling La. Speaking to India Today, Sanam opens up on his journey, the legacy he wants to leave and more.

Rishabh Pant eyes Sehwag's historic India record in South Africa Tests: Stat PackIND vs SA, Stat Pack: Rishabh Pant, Shubman Gill, Ravindra Jadeja and other Indian players will eye key milestones in the upcoming Test series against South Africa, starting November 14.

IPL 2026 retention prediction: How will CSK shape up after Jadeja-Samson trade?Chennai Super Kings hit their lowest point in the IPL, finishing at the bottom of the table for the first time. The five-time champions are now set for a major reset ahead of next season, with several gaps in the squad needing attention. The proposed trade of Ravindra Jadeja for Sanju Samson is also expected to reshape the team's balance and give CSK a fresh direction.

Not Ravindra Jadeja, Yashasvi Jaiswal should be RR captain: Aakash ChopraAakash Chopra believes Rajasthan Royals should hand the captaincy to Yashasvi Jaiswal instead of Ravindra Jadeja. His comments come amid reports of a blockbuster trade between CSK and RR involving Jadeja, Curran, and Sanju Samson.

Sania Mirza details emotional toll of Shoaib Malik divorce, recalls panic attackSania Mirza has revealed she suffered panic attacks after her divorce from Shoaib Malik. The tennis star credited her close friend, Bollywood director Farah Khan, for helping her through one of her lowest emotional moments.

SLC to take action against players considering leaving Pak after Islamabad blastThe Sri Lankan cricket board has warned its players of action who are thinking of pulling out of the ongoing Pakistan tour after a bomb blast in Islamabad. Several members of the Sri Lankan squad have informed their cricket board that they are unwilling to continue with the tour, citing security fears

Haryana CM felicitates Shafali Verma with Rs 1.5 Crore prize for World Cup winHaryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini felicitated India's Women's World Cup-winning star Shafali Verma at his official residence in Chandigarh. Shafali played a pivotal role in India's World Cup triumph, being adjudged Player of the Match in the final for scoring 87 runs and taking two wickets.

Jasprit Bumrah and Kagiso Rabada will play big role in IND vs SA Tests: Greame SmithGraeme Smith feels Jasprit Bumrah and Kagiso Rabada could define the India-South Africa Test series. The former Proteas captain said both sides must handle pace early before spinners take charge in Kolkata.

No word from Rohit Sharma on availability for Vijay Hazare Trophy: MCA OfficialMumbai Cricket Association officials state Rohit Sharma has not yet communicated his availability for the Vijay Hazare Trophy. The BCCI has reportedly urged senior players to participate in domestic cricket to remain in ODI contention.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
